title: Undiplomatic bagging as leak shows DFAT default to Labor
text:
The post-election message from the 'Berra to a waiting world that never quite made it.

With reports this week that the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade had eagerly anticipated Labor forming government on May 19, going so far as to prepare a shiny new email account for glamorous new Foreign Minister Penny Wong, the Fin’s very own highly-placed DFAT anonymous undercover source, Assistant Secretary Grade 3 to the International Public Relations and Digital Marketing Services Sub-Division, Ms Rowena Whiss-El’bloah (contact details attached), whose anonymity this paper is committed to guaranteeing, reveals preparations were well advanced to introduce the new government to foreign embassies around the world.

The Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade. Fairfax Media

DFAT departmental circular. May 18, 2019. Attn: RW-E (Make sure you remove my initials from this bit before it goes to print, OK?) For circulation to: all Embassies and High Commissions worldwide.

Subject: Comprehensive Election Briefing Notes May 19, 2019 (not to be released before midnight, sweeties, oh alright then, earlier if you must!! Sooooo exciting isn't it!!!! we’re wetting ourselves back here in the 'Berra!!!!!!! Gaia and Shayanna ordered in an extra 15 cases of Moet for the Staff Diversity and Gender Committee this evening at the Rainbow Room in the Beanbag Lounge on Level 4!! Nibblies too!!! All organic!! Don’t be late!!)

The Commonwealth of Australia can now formally confirm the long-anticipated and warmly welcomed election of a new progressive, enlightened and popularly-elected Labor government, restoring to Canberra and the country the economically sound, internationally sanctioned and democratically mandated policies and leadership it has long been craving.

As custodians and caretakers of this nation’s much-diminished and tarnished international reputation and highly valued but much-denigrated global peer-to-peer relationships network, DFAT welcomes to the seat of government a breathtakingly talented and highly intellectual team who are clearly "ready to govern" (see and please feel free to circulate as widely as possible attached beautiful high-res photo of new government team poised standing around a, er, sofa).
description: The post-election message to a waiting world that never quite made it.
